alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Preble; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN PREBLE, BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Camden to near Darrtown to near Ross, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Moraine, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Carrollton, Ross, Camden, Gratis and Seven Mile. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 23 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
